summary.title: C Programming
summary.description: This course teaches students to write programs using the C language. All fundamental features of C are covered, including arrays, functions, pointers, file I/O, string manipulation, and preprocessor directives. In addition, this course will emphasize good software design techniques, programming style, and documentation. No prior programming experience is required.

course-outcomes.outcome: Design simple programs to accomplish the tasks specified.
Write complete C programs that use the basic features of C, including variables, arrays, strings, conditional expressions, loops, functions, and pointers.

Use each of the following more advanced features of the C language in one or more programs: structures, type definitions, file I/O, string library functions, command line arguments, preprocessor directives, and memory allocation.
Write a C program that is constructed from more than one source file.
Compile and run C programs in a Windows environment.

course-content.topic: Variables, assignment statements, math expressions, printf, scanf
Function calls: math, I/O, random numbers, and other functions
Control flow statements and program design (if, if... else..., for, while, do, switch)
Writing functions, using multiple source files

laboratory-studio-outcomes.summary: Students will use what they are learning in lecture to write programs that are somewhat interesting and complex. Program design, proper style, and program testing will be emphasized. Debugging techniques will also be taught.
